subsection.name: Target
subsection.p: Anyone can translate Jajuk, no computer science is required. For any question or comments, please send me a mail : bertrand@florat.net. Translate current Jajuk version takes approximatly 3 hours.

subsection.name: README file translation
subsection.p: The README file is displayed during installation and is on the web site. Its name is README_${iso3 code}.html. Get README file of your choice as a source language. Example: use README.html as english source language at http://cvs.sourceforge.net/viewcvs.py/jajuk/jajuk/dist-files/doc/README.html or any other README file in the directory and translate it.

subsection.name: Jajuk translation
subsection.p: Jajuk uses the standard Java internationalization (i18n) system based on properties file. Files are:

${locale} is a ISO language code, see http://www.ics.uci.edu/pub/ietf/http/related/iso639.txt. jajuk.properties contains default resource bunddle (english) and you have a property file for each language.

li.p: Get property file of your choice as a source language. Example: use jajuk.properties as english source language at http://cvs.sourceforge.net/viewcvs.py/jajuk/jajuk/src/org/jajuk/i18n/jajuk.properties or any other property file in the directory.
FROM comment gives exact CVS version you translated to allow diffs with newer versions and Revision gives current CVS version of your file.
Look at file structure: It is a simple key=value format. Example:

p.span:
ParameterView.73=Check this if you allow others people to come read music from your box
ParameterView.74=Password :
ParameterView.75=Set password access to your box. If no password is set, no one can read from it

li.p: Simply translate each value, Previous example in french:

p.span:
ParameterView.73=Accepter que d'autres utilisateurs lise la musique située sur votre machine
ParameterView.74=Mot de passe :
ParameterView.75=Fixez un mot de passe à votre machine. Tant que le mot de passe n'est pas fixé, personne ne peut s'y connecter

li.p: Send me ( bertrand@florat.net) your work as a property file with your local ( ex: jajuk_ru.properties for russian ). It could be nice you send also a message in the forum: http://sourceforge.net/forum/forum.php?forum_id=315360. Contact me if you have a developer profile so I will create a CVS account for you. Then you will be able to commit and maintain your translation files directly in the repository.
(Optional) If you want to test your work ( needs ant to be installed ):
Edit ${jajuk installation path}/src/org/jajuk/Main.java file.and search for line :

ul.p: Add after this line your own local. Example :

li.p: Copy your properties file in the ${jajuk installation path}/src/org/jajuk/i18n directory
Go in the ${jajuk installation path} directory where you can find the build.xml file
Launch Jajuk and set language in the parameter view of the configuration perspective.
Off course, do not modify keys but only values.
If a value contains a '\ ', do not drop it, it means there is a space at line start or end.
Keep all punctuation and specials characters like '[','.' and so on...
Set date format according your locale, ex: DD/MM/YYYY in french, YYYY-MM-DD in english
Try to keep values length near from english's one so labels will not be too long and stay visible.
